alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 1:58PM CST until January 27 at 7:30PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Navidad River at Strane Park affecting Jackson County. Navidad River near Speaks affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. Navidad River at Sublime affecting Lavaca County. Navidad River at Morales affecting Jackson and Lavaca Counties. Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the Navidad River...including Sublime, Speaks, Morales, Strane Park...Major flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Komensky, Breslau, Hallettsville, Edna...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lavaca River near Edna. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins with the river one third of a mile wide near the Highway 59 bridge flooding secondary roads and bridges along the river. Livestock are isolated and potentially drown. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM CST Thursday the stage was 21.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 20.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:15 PM CST Thursday was 21.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.7 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.7 feet on 05/27/1948. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Lavaca River Edna 21.0 21.6 Thu 1 pm CST 24.7 19.2 13.8 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening.Friday morning at 800 AM CST.
